data: PAL Palliative Care Unit Ketamine Infusion (Module)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Restricted to Department of Palliative Care
Physician to review all previous opioid and CNS depressant orders
Ongoing analgesic and adjuvant management by Palliative Care physician
Patient Care
Respiratory Rate
q1h for 4 hour then q4h and PRN until ketamine/midazolam infusion completed
Sedation Scale
q1h for 4 hour then q4h and PRN until ketamine/midazolam infusion completed
Pain Scale
q1h for 4 hour then q4h and PRN until ketamine/midazolam infusion completed
Dysphoria Assessment Adult

Assess for dysphoric symptoms (delusions, unpleasant dreams, hallucinations) q4h while awake and if present, give LORazepam, oxazepam OR haloperidol. If dysphoric symptoms persist, stop infusion and page Palliative Care Physician
Medications
Ketamine

If pain not controlled within 24 hours, please discontinue previous ketamine order and order ketamine titratable infusion (5mg/h) standard  with 5 mg/h minimum rate, 15mg/h maximum rate with Titrate Instructions: If pain not controlled, increase by 5 mg/h q24h, with order duration of 48 hours
